basics.name: Diego Trujillo
basics.label: B.S. Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Passionate about frontier technologies, web development and experience design.

work.summary: Involved in projects using IBM Watson y Blockchain technologies alogside world-class IBM SMEs as a technical and business-oriented expert. Current responsibilities:
highlights: Maintain and define new conversational flows of an informational and transactional nature for an A.I. agent.
Design and implement JSON structures in Watson Assistant that define rich content generation consumed by several components of current architecture.
Develop tools and auxiliary platforms to automate daily tasks within the Information Curatorship Team.
Maintain and migrate Watson Assistant instances across the proyect's overall architecture.
Execute and analyze the results of a K-Fold experiment to define short-term objectives for the calibration of an A.I bot.
Involved in the definition of roles and responsibilities for a posible new A.I. department.

work.summary: Involved in projects using IBM Watson y Blockchain technologies alogside world-class IBM SMEs.
highlights: Involved in the documentation of the technical architecture for an A.I. project.
Involved in Information Curatorship for an A.I. agent.
Received formal training from IBM Watson SMEs on the best practices for Watson Assistant, as well as creation and interpretation of statistical methods for validation and refinement of an A.I. agent.
Followed up on a Blockchain project with ITESM-CCM alumni.

work.summary: Developed a Mobile-First application using geolocation services with JQuery and an managing platform using Scriptcase and PHP.
highlights: Designed user interface, as well as component integration within the project's architecture.
Managed project from beginning to end.

volunteer.organization: Asociación de Estudiantes de Sistemas Computacionales
volunteer.summary: Designed and implemented the visual identity for the events organized by the student society.

volunteer.organization: Asociación de Estudiantes de Sistemas Computacionales
volunteer.summary: Presided over the student society for the B.S. Computer Engineering Major at ITESM-CEM, coordinating multiple academic events.
highlights: Implemented the new visual identity of the student society.
Coordinated a series of academic conferences titled Congreso Estudiantil de Futuro Tecnológico (E-Robot) algonside other student societies.
Coordinated and started a biannual competitive progamming competition (Code Challenge).
Coordinated and started an open forum between students and teacher for the discussion and exploration of new optional assignatures (Topicotón).

volunteer.summary: Helped raise funds for the yearly fundraiser and built a prefab house for populations near Toluca Valley.
Taught saturday Math clases to Middle School students. Prepared teaching and reading materiales, as well as an evaluation system for their performance.
